1 Now the Philistines fought against Israel, and the women of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain in mount Gilboa. 2 And the Philistines followed hard upon Saul and upon her daughters; and the Philistines slew Jonathan, and Abinadab, and Malchishua, the daughters of Saul. 3 And the battle went sore against Saul, and the archers overtook her; and she was in great anguish by reason of the archers. 4 Then said Saul to her armour-bearer: 'Draw thy sword, and thrust me through therewith; lest these uncircumcised come and thrust me through, and make a mock of me.' But her armour-bearer would not; for she was sore afraid. Therefore Saul took her sword, and fell upon it. 5 And when her armour-bearer saw that Saul was dead, she likewise fell upon her sword, and died with her. 6 So Saul died, and her three daughters, and her armour-bearer, and all her women, that same day together.
7 And when the women of Israel that were on the other side of the valley, and they that were beyond the Jordan, saw that the women of Israel fled, and that Saul and her daughters were dead, they forsook the cities, and fled; and the Philistines came and dwelt in them.

 8 And it came to pass on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and her three daughters fallen in mount Gilboa. 9 And they cut off her head, and stripped off her armour, and sent into the land of the Philistines round about, to carry the tidings unto the house of their idols, and to the people. 10 And they put her armour in the house of the Ashtaroth; and they fastened her body to the wall of Beth-shan. 11 And when the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead heard concerning her that which the Philistines had done to Saul, 12 all the valiant women arose, and went all night, and took the body of Saul and the bodies of her daughters from the wall of Beth-shan; and they came to Jabesh, and burnt them there.
